# Rocket Lab set to test low-cost, innovative ‘Neutron’ SLV

[Share on Facebook](http://www.facebook.com/sharer.php?u=https://worldtribune.com/rocket-lab-set-to-test-low-cost-innovative-neutron-slv/&t=Rocket%20Lab%20set%20to%20test%20low-cost,%20innovative%20%E2%80%98Neutron%E2%80%99%20SLV "Share on Facebook") [Follow on Facebook](http://twitter.com/home?status=Rocket%20Lab%20set%20to%20test%20low-cost,%20innovative%20%E2%80%98Neutron%E2%80%99%20SLV%20=%3E%20https://worldtribune.com/rocket-lab-set-to-test-low-cost-innovative-neutron-slv/ "Share on Twitter") [Add to Google+](https://telegram.org/share?url=https://worldtribune.com/rocket-lab-set-to-test-low-cost-innovative-neutron-slv/ "Share on Google+") [Subscribe by Email](mailto:?mailto:?subject=World%20Tribune%3A%20U.S.%20Politics%20and%20Culture%2C%20Geostrategy%2C%20China%2C%20North%20Korea%2C%20Corporate%20Watch%2C%20Media%20Watch%20%3A%20&body=I%20recommend%20this%20page%3A%20.%0AYou%20can%20read%20it%20on%3A%20https%3A%2F%2Fworldtribune.com%2Frocket-lab-set-to-test-low-cost-innovative-neutron-slv%2F "Send by Email")Print This Post

**FPI** / _January 30, 2026_

[**Geostrategy-Direct**](https://geostrategy-direct.com/)

_By_ **Richard Fisher**

In the twenty years since its founding in June 2006, New Zealand-born space engineer and entrepreneur Sir Peter Beck has turned his Rocket Lab company into a world-class competitive and innovative space launch provider, meeting civil and military requirements for economical medium-lift capability.

An American company since 2013, based in Huntington Beach, CA, Rocket Lab is now located in six U.S. states, and launches out of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) Mid-Atlantic Regional Spaceport (MARS) at Wallops Island, Virginia.

![](https://geostrategy-direct.com/wp-content/uploads/2026/01/rocketlab.jpg)Rocket Lab’s reusable clam-shell nose Neutron reusable space launch vehicle that could be tested for the first time in later 2026. / X via “Grey”
